page.title: 09MINERAL LINES
page.content: This square is crossed by an old mineral line running from Moor Row to Whitehaven.The surrounding area was rich in iron ore and the numerous small spoil heaps litter the land around Bigrigg and Moor Row.The old line can still be traced with embankments and bridges still visible.The main A595 crosses such a bridge. Also contained within the square is Ingwell School,a residential school for children with learning difficulties.Previously a mansion,the school was opened in September 1953 and possesses a wide range of facilities including a swimming pool,football pitches and miniature golf course.Adjoining cottages house members of staff.
